page.title: 09THE BELLS APPEAL OF EYE CH.
page.content: In{Eye Church}there are six bells but they needed to be tuned and the beams that were holding them up were rotting.So in September 1984{John {Taylor & Co}had a look and they said the estimated cost of getting them repaired was Â£7,000 Taylor & Co. were {Bell Makers}from Loughborough.In Oct. 1984 the ceiling in the church was opened so the bells could come down, soon the bells were taken to the foundry to be tuned.Not only were they tuned but complete new fittings were made for them.While the bells were being tuned a lot of work was being put into the church,the old rotting beams were replaced by metal ones.All the work that was carried out on the refitting was done voluntarily under the guidance of{Mr.Harold Fitter}and {Mr.Leslie Evans}.In March 1985 the bells were ready to be collected.
